groups.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel
groups.description: Default channel configuration used as a template for all channels.

groups.name: spring.grpc.client.channels
groups.description: Named channel configurations. Each key represents a channel name with its specific configuration.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable client autoconfiguration.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.inprocess.enabled
properties.description: Whether to configure the in-process channel factory.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.inprocess.exclusive
properties.description: Whether the inprocess channel factory should be the only channel factory available. When the value is true, no other channel factory will be configured.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.observation.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable Observations on the client.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-stub-factory
properties.description: Default stub factory to use for all gRPC client stubs. Determines the type of stub (blocking, async, reactive) created for gRPC services.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.address
properties.description: The target address URI to connect to. Supports various schemes including 'static://', 'dns://', 'unix:', and custom resolvers.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.default-deadline
properties.description: The default deadline (timeout) for RPCs performed on this channel. If not set, RPCs will have no deadline.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.default-load-balancing-policy
properties.description: The load balancing policy the channel should use. Common values include 'round_robin' and 'pick_first'.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.enable-keep-alive
properties.description: Whether to enable keep-alive pings on the channel. When enabled, the channel will send periodic pings to keep the connection alive.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.health.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable client-side health checking for the channel. When enabled, the channel will monitor the server's health status.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.health.service-name
properties.description: Name of the service to check health on. If not specified, the overall server health will be checked.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.idle-timeout
properties.description: The duration without ongoing RPCs before the channel enters idle mode to reduce resource usage.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.keep-alive-time
properties.description: The delay before sending a keep-alive ping. Shorter intervals increase network burden. This value cannot be lower than the server's 'permitKeepAliveTime' setting.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.keep-alive-timeout
properties.description: The timeout for keep-alive ping requests. If the server doesn't respond within this time, the connection is considered dead.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.keep-alive-without-calls
properties.description: Whether to perform keep-alive pings even when there are no active RPCs on the connection.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.max-inbound-message-size
properties.description: Maximum message size allowed to be received by the channel. Set to '-1' to use the highest possible limit (Integer.MAX_VALUE), though this is not recommended for production use.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.max-inbound-metadata-size
properties.description: Maximum metadata (headers) size allowed to be received by the channel. Set to '-1' to use the highest possible limit (Integer.MAX_VALUE), though this is not recommended for production use.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.negotiation-type
properties.description: The negotiation type for the connection. Use 'TLS' for encrypted connections, 'PLAINTEXT' for unencrypted connections, or 'PLAINTEXT_UPGRADE' to start with plaintext and upgrade to TLS.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.secure
properties.description: Flag indicating whether strict SSL certificate validation is enabled. When false, the remote certificate validation is relaxed (use with caution).

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.service-config
properties.description: Service configuration in map format. Used to configure advanced features like retry policies, hedging policies, load balancing, and method-specific configurations. See gRPC service config documentation for available options.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.ssl.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable SSL/TLS for the channel. Automatically enabled if 'bundle' is specified.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.ssl.bundle
properties.description: Name of the SSL bundle to use for secure connections. References an SSL bundle configured via Spring Boot's SSL bundle support.

properties.name: spring.grpc.client.default-channel.user-agent
properties.description: Custom User-Agent string to be sent with requests from this channel. Useful for identifying the client application to the server.

values.description: Creates asynchronous stubs with callback-based API.
Creates reactive stubs using Project Reactor.
Start with plaintext and upgrade to TLS.
Distributes requests evenly across available backends.
